sentences.en: “The smaller the bird, the more viscous the air is,” he said, which is partly why hummingbirds can maneuver so well and for so long.
sentences.cn: “鸟类的体型越小，空气的粘性就相对越大，”他说，这也是为什么蜂鸟如此灵活且机动时间如此之长的部分原因。

sentences.en: All the fighters landed safely on the airport after the military maneuver.
sentences.cn: 在军事演习后，所有战斗机都安全降落在机场上。

sentences.en: At first I couldn't control the skateboard as well as a maneuver.
sentences.cn: 起初我对滑板并不能做到得心应手.

sentences.en: At this point - that is, early May 1906 - Roosevelt executed a brilliant maneuver.
sentences.cn: 在此时刻, 即1906年5月初,罗斯福玩了个高明的花招.

sentences.en: Ditching was a nasty but manageable maneuver.
sentences.cn: 水面迫降虽然不愉快,却是容易掌握的手段.

sentences.en: Experiment results indicate that the maneuver target tracking way is feasible.
sentences.cn: 仿真结果表明,是一种可行的机动目标跟踪方法.

sentences.en: Freezing enemy maneuver gave the proxy ground troops the ability to mass.
sentences.cn: 冻结敌行动,使代理人部队能够集结.

sentences.en: He executed the same maneuver, easily swinging his boots over the wire.
sentences.cn: 他也照此办理, 穿靴子的脚轻松地迈过铁丝网.

sentences.en: He must have considered the patrol as an effective maneuver.
sentences.cn: 他思想上一定还以为派兵侦察是条妙计.

sentences.en: However , once joined , there are more to lead, to guide, to maneuver.
sentences.cn: 然而, 如此下去就有了领导 、 工会 、 机动.

sentences.en: It has an energy source so they can live and maneuver.
sentences.cn: 它有能源设施,供他的生活和操纵飞行之用.

sentences.en: Lower courts have found, however, that Vermont Yankee does leave them some room for maneuver.
sentences.cn: 然而, 下级法院已经发现, 弗蒙特-扬基一案确实留有一些策略方面的余地.

sentences.en: That will allow them to manoeuvre the satellite into the shuttle's cargo bay.
sentences.cn: 那将使得他们能把人造卫星移入飞船的货物舱。

sentences.en: The chopper shot upward in a manoeuver matched by the other pilot.
sentences.cn: 这架直升飞机向上冲去，另一架飞机也以相同的移动方向冲了上去。

sentences.en: The Heimlich maneuver can be done in several different ways.
sentences.cn: 可以用几种不同方式来实施哈姆力克急救法.

sentences.en: The pilot was able to maneuver the crippled aircraft out of the hostile area.
sentences.cn: 飞行员成功地驾驶严重损坏的飞机驶出敌区。

sentences.en: The president has tried to manoeuver the campaign away from himself.
sentences.cn: 总统试图操控该活动，使其远离自身。

sentences.en: The ship misperformed the maneuver and almost collided with the pier.
sentences.cn: 该船操纵不当,差点撞上码头.

sentences.en: They have had to maneuver the ship to avoid unforeseen shoals and shallows.
sentences.cn: 他们必须设法避开无法预见的暗礁和浅滩.

sentences.en: This time the maneuver was too crude, they had overplayed its hand.
sentences.cn: 这次他们的手法太露骨, 结果是弄巧成拙.

words.tran_cn: 可操作性；[航][车辆][船] 机动性

trans.tran_en: a skilful or careful movement that you make, for example in order to avoid something or go through a narrow space

trans.tran_cn: [军] 机动；演习；调遣；用计谋
trans.tran_en: to move or turn skilfully or to move or turn something skilfully, especially something large and heavy
